name: Bed surface grain size
functionStatement: Surface water-groundwater exchange moderates temperature, transforms nutrients, supplies oxygen, and supports aquatic life.
descriptionMarkdown: Substrate has coarse particles with minimal fines, enabling interstitial flow per local references.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Perform a pebble count to estimate percent gravel and cobble versus fines and note evidence of embedding.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Bed surface mostly sand, silt, or consolidated fines.
Criteria: Fines >75%. Very high embeddedness.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Gravels largely buried by sand/silt.
Criteria: Fines 50-75%. High embeddedness.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Some fine matrix visible between gravels.
Criteria: Fines 25-50%. Moderate embeddedness.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Pebble count shows clean gravel-cobble with open interstices.
Criteria: Fines < 25%. Low embeddedness.

references: high-resolution imagery for bar texture classes (where available).
